name: ixpssmap
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1
body: |- wss(cixp(s0, c0, c1), co(ciun(s0, c0, c1), cmap, c0))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wss(cixp(s0, c0, c1), co(ciun(s0, c0, c1), cmap, c0)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, universe)))

body.origin:
|- wss(cixp(s0, c0, c1), co(ciun(s0, c0, c1), cmap, c0))
-| wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, universe))
-| wi(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, universe)), wss(cixp(s0, c0, c1), co(ciun(s0, c0, c1), cmap, c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, universe)), wss(cixp(s0, c0, c1), co(ciun(s0, c0, c1), cmap, c0)))
-| diffsc(s0, c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(cixp(s0, c0, c1), co(ciun(s0, c0, c1), cmap, c0))
-| wcel(c1, universe)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)

comment: An infinite Cartesian product is a subset of set exponentiation. Remark in [Enderton] p. 54. (Contributed by NM, 28-Sep-2006.)
